summary:
From 2005 to 2013, I have provided my services in the field of teaching chemistry in the very competitive sector of the private education in Greece. I obtained deep knowledge and experience on how to prepare high school students for their admission to departments of Universities and how to provide them with the necessary skills for success in the Exams.
All this experience is very well supported by a rich educational background. I am a graduate of the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens /Department of Chemistry (Bachelors Degree) and bearer of a MSc in Industrial Chemistry.
Another key and valuable factor is my ability to successfully work and teach vocational training students in private institutes.
With an insightful understanding of Chemistry, a tested constructive attitude towards pupils/students and colleagues and a hands-on expertise in teaching I feel I am in the position to offer developed skills, an interactive and positive personality and, above all, passion to any educational organization.

school.name: NATIONAL KAPODISTRIAN UNIVERSITY OF ATHENS- DEPARTMENT OF CHEMISTRY-ATHENS-GREECE-
NATIONAL KAPODISTRIAN UNIVERSITY OF ATHENS- DEPARTMENT OF CHEMISTRY- ATHENS-GREECE-

profile_positions.description:
Subjects: Analytical Chemistry, General Chemistry, Physical and Chemical Processes, Methods for Drug Control (and Laboratory), Chemical Engineering, Test and Evaluation Cosmetology (and Laboratory), Cosmetology (and Laboratory), Special Topics in Physics, Laboratory Pharmacy Physics.
The objectives of this kind of vocational training institutes are to provide any type of training, whether initial or additional, to ensure that trainees are qualified accordingly, through the provision of scientific, technical, professional and practical knowledge and to provide them with the opportunity to develop their respective skills to facilitate vocational integration into society and ensure their adaptation to the changing needs of the production process
profile_positions.title: Chemistry Teacher

profile_positions.description: I was teaching Chemistry to 16-19 years old students in this secondary education private “tutorial” The aim of a “Tutorial” is to prepare high school students for their admission to departments of Universities and to provide them with the necessary skills for success in the respective exams.
profile_positions.title: Chemistry Teacher

profile_positions.description:
I was teaching Chemistry to 16-19 years old students in this secondary education private “tutorial”. The aim of a “Tutorial” is to prepare high school students for their admission to departments of Universities and to provide them with the necessary skills for success in the respective exams.
During the summer school vacations (July-August) the Tutorial was conducting preparatory courses for the ID Diploma Program for Greek students whose parents were working abroad. In these courses I was teaching chemistry in English language to students living in Sweden, Germany and Italy and wanted to participate in the ID DP.
profile_positions.title: Chemistry Teacher

company.name: THE STATE GENERAL CHEMICAL LABORATORY, DEPARTMENT OF  ENVIRONMENT

profile_positions.company: THE STATE GENERAL CHEMICAL LABORATORY, DEPARTMENT OF  ENVIRONMENT
profile_positions.description: During my internship, I learned how to use the Laboratory Analytical Techniques (HPLC, MS, GC-IRMS, AAS, Ion Chromatography, Visible Absorption Spectroscopy of Molecular, ADCS). Then I applied all these techniques in analysing water samples, in determining the presence of mycotoxins in food, in analyzing honey samples and detecting the adulteration in alcoholic beverages.
profile_positions.title: Chemical Laboratory Analyst
